Q: What is Amazon S3 and how is it used in the Amazon Cockatoo application?

A: Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) is used to store all of the educational content that will be made available on the Amazon Cockatoo application. This content can include anything from videos to images, and documents to audio files. The benefit of using Amazon S3 is that it is highly scalable and durable, meaning that it can handle large amounts of data, and it is reliable.

Q: How is Amazon API Gateway used in the Amazon Cockatoo application?

A: Amazon API Gateway is used to create and manage the RESTful API that will be used by the application. API Gateway makes it easy to create, test, and deploy APIs, and it also has built-in support for securing APIs using OAuth and other authentication methods.

Q: What is Amazon Lambda and how is it used in the Amazon Cockatoo application?

A: Amazon Lambda is used to execute the code that will run on the backend of the application. Lambda is a serverless compute service that allows developers to write code in response to events, without worrying about the underlying infrastructure. For example, when a user requests a piece of content from the application, Lambda can be used to retrieve the content from Amazon S3 and serve it to the user.

Q: How is Amazon Cognito used in the Amazon Cockatoo application?

A: Amazon Cognito is used to manage user authentication and authorization. Cognito allows developers to add user sign-up, sign-in, and access control to applications, and it integrates with other AWS services like API Gateway and Lambda.
